meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something no longer needed or useful.
meanings.sent1: I am scrapping my old clothes to make space in my closet.
meanings.sent2: She is scrapping the broken toy to make room for a new one.
meanings.sent3: After scrapping the old furniture, the room looked much cleaner.
meanings.sent4: He was scrapping the outdated files to streamline the process.
meanings.sent5: Scrapping the unnecessary items felt liberating and refreshing.

meanings.sent1: The siblings got into a scrapping over who gets to use the computer first.
meanings.sent2: The scrapping between the two teams escalated quickly.
meanings.sent3: The playful scrapping between the puppies was entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: The political scrapping in the debate was intense and heated.
meanings.sent5: The scrapping at the schoolyard was resolved peacefully by the teacher.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking down something into its component parts for recycling or reuse.
meanings.sent1: The scrapping of the old car was done to salvage useful parts.
meanings.sent2: The scrapping of electronic devices helps in reducing electronic waste.
meanings.sent3: The scrapping of the old building revealed hidden treasures within.
meanings.sent4: The scrapping of the ship was a meticulous process to extract valuable materials.
meanings.sent5: The scrapping of plastic bottles into tiny pieces for recycling was a tedious task.
